question: What is "Lonesome George"?
option1: A tribal man living alone in the inner forest region of the Andaman and Nicobar Islands
option3: A tortoise in the Galapagos Islands
option4: A mountaineer who got lost in Mount Everest
answer: A tortoise in the Galapagos Islands
explanation: Lonesome George was a male Pinta Island tortoise and the last known individual of the Chelondis abingdonii species. This tortoise lived for 102 years from 1910 to 2012, therefore, he was known as the rarest creature in the world. Lonesome Geroge serves as an important symbol for conservation efforts in the Galapagos Islands and throughout the world. After his death, he got taxidermied and displayed at the Charles Darwin Research Station of the Galapagos Islands, Ecuador.
